faq.question: How often should solar panels be cleaned in Granville, Massachusetts?
faq.answer: Granville solar systems typically benefit from professional cleaning 2-3 times per year due to the town's heavily forested, rural environment. We recommend spring cleaning (to remove heavy pollen from Granville State Forest and surrounding woodlands), mid-summer cleaning (for dust and organic debris), and fall cleaning (before winter weather and leaf drop). Properties with significant tree coverage or near forested areas may need more frequent service. We'll assess your specific Granville location to provide a customized maintenance schedule.

faq.question: Should I clean my own solar panels or hire professionals in Granville?
faq.answer: Professional cleaning is strongly recommended for Granville rooftop systems. Key reasons: (1) Rooftop work requires proper safety equipment and training to prevent falls, (2) Incorrect cleaning methods or products can void warranties and damage panels, (3) Professional technicians identify potential problems during inspection, and (4) We carry full liability insurance. The modest cost of professional service far outweighs the safety risks and potential damage from DIY cleaning.

faq.question: What cleaning products and techniques do you use in Granville?
faq.answer: We use only manufacturer-approved methods for Granville solar installations: deionized water (prevents mineral deposits), biodegradable eco-friendly cleaning solutions safe for Massachusetts forests and environment, and specialized soft brushes designed for solar panels. Our methods are proven safe, effective, and warranty-compliant.

faq.question: Will professional solar panel cleaning void my warranty?
faq.answer: No - professional cleaning using proper methods maintains and protects your warranty coverage. We use only manufacturer-approved techniques and products.
